name: The Dinner Party Online Trivia | 'Seinfeld' - Season 5 | 10 Questions

questions.text: George's father got George a deal on his new jacket.
questions.explanation:
True.

	When Jerry asks Elaine if it's really cold outside, George comes in wearing his new Gore-tex jacket.  Since it's so puffy and huge, George can barely put his arms down and he can't feel it when Jerry and Elaine pummel him.

questions.text: Rather than wine, what does George want to drink at the dinner party?
questions.explanation:
Pepsi.

	When Elaine tells Jerry that they should stop in at the liquor store for a bottle of wine, George wonders why they should bring anything.  Elaine tells George that it's extremely rude not to bring anything and George goes into a long-winded conversation about drinking things at parties.

questions.text: What kind of babka do Jerry and Elaine try to buy?
questions.explanation:
Chocolate Babka.

	On the way to the party, Elaine suggests that they go to the bakery to pick up a babka for the party since one bottle of wine isn't enough for four people to bring.  At the bakery, they plan on picking up Chocolate Babka, the bakery's specialty.

questions.text: Who do Elaine and Jerry talk to at the bakery?
questions.explanation:
Barbara and David.

	When Jerry and Elaine arrive at the bakery, they realize that they forgot to take a number, so they try and ask a woman for hers.  They end up realizing that the people they're asking are also going to the party, and they miss out on the last Chocolate Babka in the bakery.

questions.text: While Jerry and Elaine are in the bakery, what are Kramer and George buying?
questions.explanation:
Wine.

	While Elaine and Jerry are at the bakery, George and Kramer head to the liquor store.  Kramer suggests a $12 bottle of wine and he tells George to pay for it since he doesn't carry his wallet.  When George asks why, Kramer says that his osteopath tells him that it curves his spine.

questions.text: What type of cake to Elaine and Jerry end up buying?
questions.explanation:
Babka.

	When Barbara and David head to the party with the last chocolate babka, Elaine and Jerry continue to search for a good cake.  Elaine suggests carrot cake, but Jerry says that carrots shouldn't be made in a cake.  She also suggests Black Forest Cake, but Jerry states that it sounds too scary.  When Jerry suggests a Napoleon cake, Elaine doesn't think that Napoleon should have a cake named after him.  When Elaine goes to the counter, the cashier tells them that there's cinnamon babka left, so they buy it.

questions.text: What do George and Kramer try to pay for their purchase with?
questions.explanation:
A hundred dollar bill.

	When George and Kramer try to do this, the cashier says that he can't change a hundred, so Kramer and George go to get change.  They go to a nearby newsstand, but they can't buy cheap things and change the hundred.  Kramer buys a newspaper, gum, Clark Bar, and Penthouse Forum with George's money.

questions.text: What do Elaine and Jerry find in their cake?
questions.explanation:
A hair.

	While they're waiting for George and Kramer, Elaine looks into the box of cinnamon babka and finds a hair.  They decide to exchange it since Jerry finds it disgusting.  When Jerry suggests it might be Elaine's hair, she says that people could eat food off her hair since it's taken care of so well.

questions.text: Why does Jerry throw up in the bakery?
questions.correct: Because of the black and white cookie
options: Because of the hair on the cake
Because he was fighting the flu
questions.explanation:
Because of the black and white cookie.

	When Jerry buys the black and white cookie, he goes on about how the black and the white work great together.  Soon, they don't end up mixing in his stomach, and he has to throw up in the bakery washroom.  What's ironic is that Jerry broke his vomit streak.  Before this, he hadn't thrown up in fourteen years.  When Jerry and Elaine exchange the cake, the cashier keeps coughing into it and they wait for George and Kramer.  They're freezing at the liquor store because someone blocked their car into their space.

questions.text: Elaine's foot gets hurt at the bakery.
questions.explanation:
True.

	George and Kramer wait in the liquor store for the car to be unblocked and George accidentally knocks over a shelf of chardonnay with his coat, so he gives the coat to the owner to pay him back.  Their car is finally freed when a man who looks like Saddam Hussein (with an English accent) finally moves his car.  When they pick up Elaine and Jerry, Jerry has broken his vomit streak, and a man with a cane accidentally sticks his cane on Elaine's foot.  When they arrive at the party, they give their cake and wine to the hostess and leave.
